p.5: Harnham has partnered with a high-growth research and development digital platform that improves speed-to-market for consumer goods. This organization is centered around AI and Data Science with a core focus on the Food manufacturing industry.

li: Oversee and action the implementation of the organization's platform for customers including Data Transformation, Model Building, Publishing to Production, and Evaluation of Results.
li.1: Focus on Customer Experience and Media Optimization by leveraging machine learning and statistical modeling to translate ambiguous business objectives into concrete data-driven solutions.
li.2: Help to communicate client needs to the internal product team by informing the direction of future product feature development
li.3: Work cross-functional with high-level non-technical and technical stakeholders both internally and externally.

li: Hands-on with statistical analysis & modeling through Python specifically (i.e., Predictive modeling)
li.1: A mixture of both leadership and Hands-on capabilities in a fast-paced environment.
li.2: Strong technical abilities in Python scripting, AWS, R, and SS3.
li.3: 6-8 years of commercial experience, in "media optimization"
li.4: Fantastic communication and verbal skills in a client-facing capacity.
li.5: An in-depth understanding of Bayesian Statistics is an essential requirement for this role.

p.15: As a Consumer Data Scientist, you can expect to earn a competitive base salary of up to $190,000 with a bonus and potential equity.
p.19: Please register your interest by sending your resume to Matt LeConte on this page.

i: Advanced Analytics, AWS, SS3, Marketing Analytics, Insights, Media Analytics, SQL, Python, Python Scripting, R, Tableau, PowerBI, Statistical Modelling, Bayesian Statistics, Regression, Logistic Regression, Segmentation, Customer Segmentation, Random Forests, Attribution, Client-Facing, Stakeholder Engagement, User Journey, CRM, NLP, North America, Remote, Chicago
